Reviews.Title: “NO refrigerator, NO microwave, NO elevators, NO lobby computer / printer, NO shuttle... and an $8 per night parking fee!”
Reviews.Author: MopacMan
Reviews.Content: They should just call themselves the 'No Hotel'. What this property is however is a VERY basic circa 1972-style place of lodging. What kept me from giving it only One Star is that the bed was damn comfortable. The rooms are painfully small. Ancient bathroom. Good towels though and the AC / Heater worked well. Again NO frig or microwave unless you rent a suite. This is 2012 right? Front desk staff were beyond incompetent. Either very inexperienced and in most cases simply lazy. This is a sizable property and all they care about is the Churn & Burn. Noticed tons of families there on vacation. Not an option for any future stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Basic room”
Reviews.Author: lee746
Reviews.Content: If you want a place to store your luggage and have a bed then this place will do the trick. No frills with this place. I did find it weird that there are two comfort inns on either side of the highway, but i had a GPS so it didnt take me to the wrong one, i can see how it can.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Rooms, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Ron P
Reviews.Content: Located near Sea World & Old Town, this property is kept well maintained both inside & out. For the prices charged here, you would be hard pressed to get anything better. The rooms are well appointed, lacking only an in-room refrigerator. The beds are extra comfortable and the shower massage worked great. Centrally located for our goings in all directions, it was quite a gem. The friendly staff were quick to provide good service. The in-room high speed internet worked quite well.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: ellen32707
Reviews.Content: This hotel isn't fancy, but it is immaculate and is well-maintained. The staff from front office to housekeeping to food service are pleasant, helpful, and caring. I'm typically an RV'er, but when visiting San Diego, this hotel is where we choose to stay. When I was injured at Sea World while there on my first stay and had to extend my visit, management was concerned and accommodating. Breakfast in the Coronado Room is free for guests and is wonderful with Belgian Waffles you cook yourself from the batter, fruits, juices, coffees, bagels, pastry, toast, regular and low-fat milk. This hotel is convenient to everywhere in San Diego. The few concerns I had on the second visit were rapidly addressed to my satisfaction. We will be back on our next trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive lodging in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: hillretiree
Reviews.Content: Recent reviews of this property are hardly favorable. My experience was better: my room was clean, equipment worked (although it took me 15 minutes to get the TV channel I wanted because no matter what I hit on the remote, it kept advertising pay per view movies), and I had no real problems. It seemed noisier than average, and parking spaces were quite tight. The free breakfast had Comfort Inn's usual range of foods, though the eggs and sausage were a bit below par; the breakfast room is huge, and constantly busy but there was almost always room, and the food kept coming.Front desk staff was a little brusque but not unpleasant--I would say the hotel, which is large, was understaffed. It's kind of a factory, big place, heavy traffic,move 'em in, move 'em out, lots of families. There are not a lot of restaurants nearby, and the recommendations from the front desk were mostly chains. But the good points are worth noting: it is cheap (about $70 a night) and convenient to many attractions as well as to the interstates.If you're looking for a great hotel, forget it. If you're looking for a place to sleep in a convenient location at a reasonable price, it should work--but based on the other reviews, you may want to check out your room before you unpack.

Reviews.Title: “nothing great”
Reviews.Author: ravi s
Reviews.Content: I read reviews online and booked the hotel but there was nothing great the rooms that we got was smelly in the beginning. The rooms are not sound proof so anything that happened outside or in the next room could be heard. Couples be carefully!!. The internet was not working so I had to hook up with the hotel that was next to us. The breakfast was a joke nothing great. You cannot use the kitchen after breakfast hours. Families with kids please book room with kitchen other wise your infants or toddlers will not have mircrowave or cooler to store milk. Overall i will not recommend this hotel to any one the price i paid i could have got a better place.

Reviews.Title: “TAKE HEED YOU DO NOT WANT TO STAY HERE!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: not h
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for 3 nights March 13-16 during spring break. We did the advance purchase. We read the reviews for this hotel(due to booking error) after we booked and thought that well most of the bad reviews were last year and it seemed that they were trying to turn things around. Additionally we were not aware there were two hotels on the same street so when I initially did my research it was on the other hotel and when we finally booked it we booked for this one instead of the other in error.We payed around 99.00 a night for a room with a queen bed and a bunk bed for our two kids. The room as previous guest stated had a very musty smell. The carpet color was hard to really decipher and had several variations showing. The bathroom was very dirty. The door had chipped and cracked paint. If you looked up while running water in the sink there was a space which had an outlet and a strip that was dirt riddled. The shower curtain was filthy. The bathroom sink water ran constantly and could not be turned off. When I enquired about a resolve I was told that they would speak with the manager and call me back. We waited about 2 hours and we had to go because we had tickets to a show. When we returned the problem had not been fixed and when we called back the new person now had no knowledge of our complaint and stated that they were probably working on it and would get back to me when they returned. At the point I deemed it useless to complain about anything else as their would be no resolve. We tried to spend as less time as possible in the room. The bathtub had a chip and the tile was clearly dirty with years of caked on dirt. We wore our flip flops in the shower and my children were not permitted to walk bare foot anywhere in the room. The hair dryer was missing the wire part that covers the barrel and if you were not careful you coould burn yourself. The hair dryer was also rusted. I always bring Lysol and febreeze when I travel and a few other cleaning items. I spent a couple of hours cleaning this room since it was spring break other hotels in the area were booked. The bunk beds were unleveled and the sheets on one of the beds were dirty. Good thing I brought my own. The dishes in the kitchen area were also dirty. I would not have used them anyway. My son spilled juice on the old brown blanket that was under the comforter and it was purple and they just made the bed up and did not change it. You could clearly see there was a stain. The coffee pot was also filthy as well as the tray that everything set on. The refrigerator had an offensive odor whenever you opened it. The chairs at the table were broken and had holes. The Queen bed comforter had a holes in it and the sheets had some old black stains. The room was very small you lose space due to them putting in a bunk bed. A kitchen chair width is the distance from the queen bed to the bunk bed. the chair touched my bed and the bunk bed. So the rooms were very small. There were various types of stains on the walls, baseboards, and ceilings throughout the room. I agree with the other quest who stated not a deluxe room. The " breakfast buffet" is housed in a room that appears to be the size of one of their hotel rooms. The food on one day was powdered eggs, bacon, cereals, boiled, eggs, yogurt, coffee, pastry, toast, juice, and coffee. They had on dish of eggs and bacon they would put out for the masses of people. The lady would bring out the bacon and then go back to get the eggs by the time she came back the bacon was all gone. I also watched the same lady go and stick her hand in the trash because it was full then open the door and remove the eggs from the microwave and come out and serve them. I also watched her then change the trash then go over and fill up the cereal containers. All done without gloves. There were two ladies one wore gloves one did not. The waffle area was a nightmare. The machine was always empty and the area was a mess. It took over 1 1/2 to actually have a complete breakfast due to the way they brought out the microwave foods. I did not eat any of the pastries but some other guest were complaining that the pastry tasted stale. The overall set up has to be a health hazzard as far as how the food is prepared and served I would honestly say that there was a motel 6 and some other 1 star rated hotels that cost about 39.00 per night I would not pay $39.00 a night to stay here. I have always liked Comfort Inn and Suites but due to my stay at this one. I WILL NEVER EVER CHOSE A COMFORT INN HOTEL AGAIN. Any chain like Comfort Inn that would allow this Hotel to represent them is not a place I would stay. If I had the option of rating this hotel with a 0 star it would have received that rating. This place in the bottom of the bucket more like a motel not a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Big Bang for your Buck”
Reviews.Author: MauiRanger
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Comfort Inn & Suites on our way back from a 10 day trip just prior to going back to Hawaii and had a very good experience. Some of the positives of this hotel are: 1. The front desk workers are marvelous. They were fast, friendly, and very helpful to anything we needed. Check-in and check-out was a breeze and they took the time out to talk with me and answer some "tourist" questions that I had. 2. The rooms were in excellent condition. I hear other reviewers crying about how old the rooms are. To me, the rooms were in great condition especially when you consider the price. If you want custom decor, fancy carpet, a luxurious bathroom, etc. then shell out the dough and go to a 4+ star hotel. 3. Parking was only $8 per day. We payed $22/day (for 3 days) at the DoubleTree downtown which was very difficult to do being that we were hotel guests. Some people talk about lack of parking space or location of parking, but we found the parking adequate. Unless each room gets their own stall, you can't expect a prime spot all the time. 4.The location is in the Hotel Circle area. Very convenient to get on and off of the freeways. The outside automobile noise was non-existent once you went inside the room. It's also a stone throw's away from the Mission Valley and Fashion Valley Malls. There are also ton's of stores and eateries in the area. Some of the things that could have been better were: 1. Breakfast was like a madhouse - People were everywhere and the food ran out quickly. It was amazing watching some of the guests take food and eat. You would think as though it was their last meal on earth. When things are free you notice some level of class goes down the drain but I guess that's human nature. A big downer was that breakfast wait staff were not too friendly and NONE of them were smiling. I've read a recent review saying that the breakfast staff seemed overwhelmed and that is very accurate. They looked like they weren't enjoying their jobs. Since the breakfast area is so small, we took our food back to our room as there were no open seats available. Having a complimentary breakfast is such a breath of fresh air and we really appreciated it. Maybe a bigger room and a friendlier breakfast staff (it's hard to look at long faces so early) would've made our morning. 2. Noise from rooms - We stayed on St. Patricks Day and there seemed to be various high school and college groups in the hotel. One thing we didn't like was that the noise level (after 11 p.m.) was not policed better. It would be nice if a security staff member come around after hours to maintain the noise level in on the floors. There were kids running around chasing each other in and out of rooms on our floor. As we walked pass other rooms on our floor, the loud laughing and screaming were very audible. We were glad that they weren't our neighbors for the night. All in all, we had a great experience at the hotel. The staff's friendliness and professionalism made our stay comfortable. We definitely would stay here again and recommend it to our friends. Mahalo!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Staff, but stay somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: Michael B
Reviews.Content: We arrived late at night and actually went to the wrong Comfort Inn first. We found the right one and got checked in. The clerk was very nice and helpful. I asked her about the old style outside rooms and she commented that they were 'grandfathered in' with Comfort Inn's as the owner bought this property and converted it. We were given a family suite on the lower level of the hotel, but there were not any parking spots left by our room so we had to park on the other side of the building. We got to the room and there was a kitchenette in the room which consisted of a very old table that was re-screwed together several times from being broken. The bathroom was not very clean and the rooms were very noisy! The fridge was very noisy and so were the neighbors. The first morning we went to breakfast around 8am and went thru the line and got eggs, sausage, coffee, juice and rolls. I got ready to return to the line and found that there was no food out and that there was a huge line. The breakfast area is very small and does not seat very many people. The waitstaff seemed overwhelmed and nobody was there to wipe tables or anything let alone prepare food. This was by far the worst Comfort Inn that I have ever stayed at! The 2nd night we were able to park by our room, but the breakfast was worse the 2nd day. We went earlier, but they were out of sausage, out of bacon and had just a little bit of eggs and a few sweet rolls and muffins out. For an advertised "hot breakfast buffet" it was very pitiful! I would not recommend staying if eating breakfast is important to you. The first night we had coffee packets in our room, the 2nd night we didn't. Guess you only get one per stay! Due to the noisy rooms, noisy neighbors, the lack of parking, the lack of breakfast and the cleanliness issues I would pass this hotel by!

Reviews.Title: “Good location,smallest rooms I've been in”
Reviews.Author: teddy s
Reviews.Content: Arrived with A coupon from an add that sais "delux rooms".got a tiny room that the hotel calls standard room.add sais "aaa approved ",but the the man at the desk did'nt receive my aaa card.how would you call that?my advice is find another hotel.very small bath with a shower head so low that reached my chest.crowded dining room.

Reviews.Title: “Very poor service”
Reviews.Author: Raj988
Reviews.Content: Service is very poor. All that marketing stuff that is put in their website does not mean anything. The hotel manager David gardner does know how to work with customers. He is pretty useless.

Reviews.Title: “College Sports Team”
Reviews.Author: jessmall18
Reviews.Content: We had a college Lacrosse team stay here, and were VERY pleased with this hotel, the accommodations were great, free breakfast was HUGE (and good), and it is close to so many things in the area....especially the fields. Andrew, the Manger, was great to work with and very accommodating for our players, coaches, and even traveling parents. We will 100% return again because of Andrew's willingness to accommodate our 15+ rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Super Location/Tony the Tiger Breakfast (Grrrreat!)”
Reviews.Author: TriciaSK
Reviews.Content: Super Location/Tony the Tiger Breakfast (Grrrreat!) First off, late January (off season), in general, is an opportunity to visit San Diego with fewer crowds and lower hotel rates. That said, we enjoyed a leisurely-paced Hotel Circle atmosphere. This property banks up against beautiful green foothills and is peaceful and quiet. It' s location is fantastic! Turn right and you're at Fashion Valley; left lands you in Old Town. A freeway exit over... SeaWorld; a little farther, Seaport Village. The rooms have been a bit updated, but the addition of a flat screen, placing the large chest of drawers in the closet {simply to free up space}, and plusher linen is in order. There is no fridge, but plenty of ice dispensers, so bring a chest to keep your water/soda cold. The courtesy wifi is a plus and the ample breakfast served in a cheery dining room is ideal for getting fueled until dinner time. These basic perks offset the parking fee.

Reviews.Title: “Above average and improving, but a shade short of Very Good”
Reviews.Author: dragon789wv
Reviews.Content: In my last review, I discussed several items that made it seem that this motel seemed to be going downhill. I am pleased to state that it seems that some of the complaints or issues addressed last September seems to be corrected; however, some new issues have come up which I hope management now realizes and hopefully correct. First, the good news: The defrosted waffles (erroneous stated as pancakes) has been replaced by freshly (self)made ones, and even included a 'Flavor of the Day' batter (would be good to have a sign so we know WHAT it is!), in addition to the Original recipe. It seemed that the entire breakfast has been upgraded, more selections, and much better than before, and for that, we do commend management in attempting to rectify deficiencies. We did notice that there was no cocoa or hot chocolate, which was eliminated. Room was very good for the price that we paid. However ... a couple of things in the room (1420) that were awry were: Dripping faucet in wash basin; surprised that the maid did not report this (embarrassed to say that I forgot to report it when I checked out). When turning on the handle/knob for shower, it's always been my experience that turning clockwise (left) is for Hot water and turning to the right is for Cold water - it is reversed here, but not sure if this is an anomaly or deliberate. Air conditioner/heater was extremely noisy when going on and kept me up at night; had to finally turn it off in order to sleep! I am hoping it is just this ONE room, as I did not have problems of this nature last time I was here. Finally, the $8 charged for parking still bugs me. Should not need this, as hotel is NOT in a downtown area; I realize that it is in Hotel Circle, but some of the other hotels in that area do not charge for parking. Wonder why Comfort Inn feels the need to charge - besides the obvious "making money". Anyway, happy to report improvements and hope to continue to see in the future when we stay here.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: morenie
Reviews.Content: nice breakfast eggs sausage bagel waffles included ...wifi heated pool hot tub...good price.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could ask for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Gordon R
Reviews.Content: The basics: friendly service, comfortable bed, clean room, not cramped for space, good breakfast. Other issues: They let me check in way early (a room was ready). On the other hand, standard building construction, so you might need earplugs if your neighbor is a bunch of small-hours party animals! (mine weren't). Can walk (a long one) to Old Town.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly well located, a good selection of breakfasts and at the right price.”
Reviews.Author: TAMember04092012
Reviews.Content: Having got to know the San Diego area a fair bit I really don't think this or it's sister hotel in Hotel Circle. N. could be better placed. That is for Mission or Ocean Beach (6/7mins), Sea World (5 mins) and Downtown (trolley from right outside) for example. I-8 and I-5 are also on the doorstep. As others have highlighted, it's really quiet due to the good layout when it was built. The rooms are big, good for disabled people also and the staff all friendly that I encountered. The pool was heated it being December almost and the accompanying water spa if anything too hot! My one gripe is that the whole Hotel Circle was built for just that. HOW can they have the cheek to charge what is a stealth charge of $8pn for car-parking? To my mind that is outrageous/ It's not Downtown or off some busy neighbourhood. That said it's still good value especially if you shop around on-line as I did.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for 1 night stay”
Reviews.Author: Heath J
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for one night to catch a flight out of San Diego airport. Below average room, nothing fancy at all. Should have stayed at the Comfort Inn down the street. For a 1 night stay though, it done ok.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: lrios86
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel two different times. The first stay was rather good. Room was clean and smelled like bleach because of the pool. Only issue was one of our facial towels had remeneces of Cheeto's. Second stay was good bt room was not as great. There were holes in the curtains and blood on one of the pillows. Breakfast was good...room was just rather small for so many guest. Overall great location and price. There is a parking fee at ths hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Better than Average, but a bit short of Very Good”
Reviews.Author: dragon789wv
Reviews.Content: We've been staying at this hotel for many years. We like its location and proximity to the various attractions, easy access on/off freeway, mall across the freeway. While the hotel is still pretty good, we feel that it has gone downhill just a bit, making it less attractive, but still decent. For breakfast, it seems that they now have those (defrosted) pancakes, whereas before we were able to make our own waffles, which were pretty good. The pancakes were not that good and nuking it in the microwave made the edges tough. They started charging $8.00 for parking the last few times we were there. Not sure why besides the obvious reason to make more money. It kinda sticks in my craw when hotels charge you a parking fee when they are already charging you for the room - could be just me - and it is not a 'luxury' hotel in a downtown area. When we checked in the room after a very hot and dusty day, there were no bath towels. Yes, it was brought quickly, but ... Used to have the USA newspaper - now it's Wall Street Journal, which may be fine for some people, but ... WSJ certainly not for everybody. Maybe we're getting older, but it seems that the ice machine by the pool seems further away now! Or we were just so tired that day and would feel better after a good night's rest! All in all, still decent hotel, though not as good as it used to be. Disappointed in that respect.

Reviews.Title: “Central location, if you have a car”
Reviews.Author: clalves
Reviews.Content: Receptionist, friendly. Hotel easy to locate right off freeway. Requested room, top floor and away from main road received. Couldn't hear traffic from room. No refrigerator, has coffee maker. No gym. Continental breakfast, good. There is a few mom & pop type resturants in the area. No other choices. There is a bus system that runs by. But you really need a car from this area. Not far from the San Diego light rail system, Old Town, Mission Beach, Sea World and the Mexican Border, Zoo etc. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: Tripping123_11
Reviews.Content: 0 Rating! Filthy, filthy, filthy. We made several trips to the lobby to complain about various things. Were not a picky family, we just want a clean room. The rugs were beyond filthy, pack socks! The shower wall was slimy, the grounds had garbage & the walkways were stained with various spillage from over time & the pool had "lots of floaty things" said our kids! Good thing we were gone from 9am to 9pm each day or we would have checked out right away. The lady beside us left within an hour of checking in due to the filth. We also ran out of TP but the cleaning lady had none on her cart. We asked for a fridge upon arrival on the Monday & after asking several times, we finally got it on the Wed night. We complained to the manager on check out on the Friday. 2 families in front of us were also complaining.

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay here again”
Reviews.Author: mesagirl30
Reviews.Content: I could not believe how small this room was. We had the queen sized bed with the bunk beds. They were almost touching! Not even enough room to walk between them. And the rest of the room was just as small. They bunk beds were NOT twin sized as they say. They were more like toddler beds. And there is a weight limit of 100lbs. (not mentioned anywhere in their ads). The parking lot and parking spaces were so tiny I could barely maneuver or park my Yukon. The breakfast would have been ok, if we were able to get to any of the food. It was so crowded we could barely walk around and if we were able to find a table, it was dirty. The only good thing I can say about the stay was that the front desk staff and the housekeepers were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: hapamoma
Reviews.Content: I've never written a review for a hotel before but feel compelled to do so today after my experience at The Comfort Inn Hotel Circle.I will never stay there again nor would I ever recommend it to anyone. We don't travel often and are not high maintenance, but I expected a clean, basic room with everything that the description of the hotel mentions. House keeping was awful...no towels either day we stayed there. We had to ask for them each day. Carpets were dirty and were not vacuumed while we were there. Pool restroom was filthy and toilet was blocked with feces when pool opened in the morning. The stench coming from it was unbearable. Totally disgusting. Obviously no one looked at it either after it closed or before it opened. Very bad experience and I will never go back.

Reviews.Title: “Checked out before staying overnight”
Reviews.Author: Headda1479
Reviews.Content: Absolutely filthy. Shredded and filthy curtains. Rip in bedspread. Tie strap holding wall lap to the wall. Old smell. Could hear the TV of the unit next door through the wall. Looked like they crammed a bunkbed in a single bed room. We checked out within 4 hours of checking in an found a much better hotel just up the road.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Silver54
Reviews.Content: Stayed here July 25-27th. Nice hotel, very clean, lots of people stay here so be prepared for lot of breakfast crowds. Tip go before 8:00 and you shouldn't have any problems. Nice bed, room was clean, no problem checking in or out. Nice pool area with lots of nice families. Easy to find and close to lots of attractions. They do charge 7.95 for parking and its very close, you better not have a big car or you won't be parking in the underground lot.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Clean Room”
Reviews.Author: sandieck
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the kitchenette room with 1 double bed and 2 small bunk beds. Kitchenette consists of a small refrigerator/freezer, freezer can hold about 10 bottles of water. Stove has two electric burners. Microwave is small as well. There is a sink and they provide dish soap. There is a small supply of utensils, pots, pans, large plastic bowls, dishes, bowls, and silverware. The Kitchenette worked well for our needs. Bunk beds are small with a thin mattress that will hold up to 100 pounds each bed, but we did have up to 150 pounds in the bottom bunk and it was fine. This is a very basic room that was clean. The nearby restaurant Ricky's was not exciting but you might do better with their breakfast offerings.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to crash for the night . . . Nothing fancy, but cozy!”
Reviews.Author: Smd4664
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for 2 nights primarily as a place to sleep, as we were in San Diego visiting family. We were in room 2121, with your standard 2 queen beds / 1 bath. It was a typical hotel room - dark floors, crazy color bedspreads, but it was very clean and cozy. Let me tell you right away, if you are not looking for merely a place to sleep, shower, and get some breakfast, look elsewhere. I would highly recommend this Comfort Inn to travelers who are NOT in San Diego to lounge around in their hotel. If you are spending all day out sightseeing and experiencing San Diego's attractions and want an affordable, clean place to sleep, this is the place for you. The staff we encountered were friendly and polite and willing to answer any questions. Also, the continental breakfast was good (I have seen better and I have seen much worse) ... it had danishes, toast, muffins, waffles, apples, oranges, bagels, cereal, hard-boiled eggs, juices, coffee, tea, hot chocolate, and caramel or vanilla hot drinks. One thing that was disappointing was that the waffles were frozen and store-bought. I would like to say once more how CLEAN the room was, which was very much to my liking. If you have any questions, I would be happy to answer them. Happy Travels!

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: reviewgal4
Reviews.Content: Breakfast was nothing special. Could not find a seat, very crowded, and noisy. The only hot breakfast was the waffles that you had to make yourself. The line for the waffles took about 30 minutes (no joke) because everyone in line took about 2-3 waffles each. Besides the waffles, there was hard boiled eggs, pastries, cereal, fruit, coffee, and assorted juices. The rooms were average because the toilets were hard to flush, the pullout bed had missing springs, and the sink was in one of the rooms in the suite, not in the actual bathroom. The room service was very good and quick and the staff was very polite and tried their best to meet all of our needs!! The pools were crowded, but they were very fun for the kids. The hot tub was at a perfect temperature, but the pool was a little chilly at night. The ice cream vending machine outside was out of order :'(, but in past times we were there it was working and had a big variety of delicious ICE CREAM!!!!!!!!(: The lobby was very nice looking, but the elevators were a little scary, because the flooring was cracked and it squeaked a lot. The hotel was overall pretty clean, and I would recommend it to people who want have easy access to places like the mission bay park, sea world, the san diego zoo, and downtown san diego.

Reviews.Title: “Gotta Say Happy for SD”
Reviews.Author: GreyEyeGirl
Reviews.Content: A very busy weekend - nice place to stay. For this area and hotel the people are crazy at least when I was there, I don't know anywhere that wouldn't be in SD? But I was happy for the price I paid and the service I got. The hotel - while it may be due for some updates, it provided me with a nice stay in SD. I think the staff really cared. It was packed in the lobby, but the staff was doing their best, that matters to me. I slept great. The place was so perfectly located, we were able to see all the attractions we wanted to. Enjoyed the pool even after a day at the beach with a little bbq action made our room experience fun. People just got to spice up their trip and have fun - like me!

Reviews.Title: “Was good for the family”
Reviews.Author: chrismec
Reviews.Content: Room was clean. I never had that sceeved out feeling from the room. We staying in a room with bunk beds for the kids. It was oh so nice being able to put them to bed in their own room. Breakfast is crazy busy. Bunch of parents running around trying to get food for their kids who are on the verge of throwing fits. So be prepared for that. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The worst customer service”
Reviews.Author: michthom9
Reviews.Content: First, they gave us the wrong price for the hotel. I thought the deal was too good to be true since they stated it included 2 free Sea World tickets. I asked the person I talked with on the phone 3 times to confirm the price. Then the email simply listed the price as "SeaWrldpkg." It then took 5 days to get a manager to tell me that the price did NOT include the Sea World tickets. They didn't even want to give us any type of discount for the mistake (I finally got them to knock off the price by $10/night but it was like pulling teeth to get this). Then on the first morning we were there, we noticed the shower curatin was missing. It took 35 minutes (no exaggeration) to provide us with a shower curtain. We were on a tight schedule that morning and were thus running late. Despite these things, we barely got an apology. They obviously could care less if you have a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE....DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 2parrots4me
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a VERY BAD experience for us. When we arrived we were given the key to 'our' room and when we went in there was other luggage already there. We returned to the desk only to find another guest complaining of the same thing. We got the 'correct' key, but did not feel safe because we wondered who else might be given 'our' key. When we got into the correct room we were very uncomfortable with the safety of this hotel since we wondered who might attempt to get in 'our' room with a key. In the early hours of the morning we were awakened by a young girl who was knocking on all the doors looking for 'Ted'. "Ted are you in there" was her repeated phrase as she went up and down the sidewalk knocking on doors. There seemed to be a party on the property as there was also loud music playing that could be heard in our room. In the morning we went to the breakfast room during serving hours, and they had already started putting the food away, and had locked the door with us in the room. I think this is a fire hazard!!! Reluctantly the juice machine was turned back on and we were able to get a cold bagel since the toaster had been removed. When the attendant could not be located to unlock the door other guests opened a window to climb out of the room!! We had originally planned on staying 2 nights, but when the 1st night went so terribly wrong we wanted to cancel and get a refund as we had paid cash. We were told there was no cash on the property, and no manager. When we insisted on speaking to someone in charge, finally the housekeeping manager arrived and we told her of the problems. While we were waiting another guest came into complain that while he was in bed, someone used the same key to his room and if the chain had not been on the door, a complete stranger would have walked in!! We were told this hotel does not have an owner and is being foreclosed on by the bank. Not our problem.... this lady was understanding of our situation and she made a call to someone who authorized our refund even though the desk clerk said there was no money or manager. We were more than glad to leave this horrible place and we found another hotel for the rest of our stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID”
Reviews.Author: DarthVespa
Reviews.Content: Just a notch above shabby. Desk staff gave me non-functional number for taxi service. Towels, etc. not changed. Ice machines broken. "Breakfast" minimal, at best! Room keys repeatedly de-magnetize. Takes TEN + minutes for running water to become warm. Sink drains very, very slowly . . . You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Best breakfast I've seen at a budget hotel!”
Reviews.Author: izfo
Reviews.Content: This place was great! Mind you, it's not a 5 star resort or something, but for a budget hotel (under $60/night/couple) this place was awesome. When booking at the counter, I had some trouble using a coupon code which apparently only works when you call in a reservation so the girl behind the counter let me use her cell phone even though she was about to finish her shift. Service overall was superb. The location is average. I mean, it's not exactly close to San Diego attractions like Balboa Park, 5th Avenue, the waterfront, etc. but it's in the same boat as a gazillion other hotels which are located along Hotel Circle Road. (Hotel Circle Rd. N and Hotel Circle Rd. S. are on opposite sides of a major highway so if you have a car, there's easy access to the rest of the city... otherwise, not so much.) Speaking of location... There is a Comfort Suites hotel right on the other side of the highway (on Hotel Circle NORTH) that is less nice and more expensive so make sure you know to go to this one. When I called the 1-888 number for Choice Hotels and wanted to book this place, they by mistake almost confirmed me for the OTHER hotel... I didn't notice until they told me the price which was almost double! So watch out. The room itself was spacious, as was the bathroom but I think that's because we got the handicapped room (even though we didn't need or request it). I'm not sure how other rooms in the hotel compare. Beds were comfy and TV worked fine. Parking is $5 per car, so that's not bad. The breakfast at this hotel is amazing compared to other budget hotels we've stayed at. Beverages: several kinds of coffees and teas, cappuccino machine with 2 or 3 types, hot chocolate, 4 different kinds of juice, water, 2% milk & skim milk. Food: Oakmeal, 2 or 3 kinds of cereal, waffles with syrup, scrambled eggs, muffins, cookies, boiled whole eggs, toast with butter or cream cheese and honey and several types of jam, sausages, english muffins, ...and more (can't remember everything). UNFORTUNATELY, we slept in and most of that food was already gone by the time we got there after 9am (breakfast runs from 6:30 to 9:30am). A lot of people were packing food to go, which wasn't very nice... but we still managed to get a decent breakfast. There's an outdoor pool which looked quite pleasant and well maintained. After spending 2 weeks on the road on a sort of Southwestern U.S. roadtrip and sleeping in a few seedy looking budget hotels, I'd like to note that this one looked much better. There were lots of families with kids of all ages, etc.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: funtobeme
Reviews.Content: This hotel room is basic, clean, comfortable enough and in a convenient location (any hotel in the Hotel Circle loop for that matter) for the touristy things to do and see in San Diego ( 5 miles to everything - Sea World, The Zoo, Mission Beach, etc). Spent 3 nights at this hotel and found it to be a nice stay. The area felt safe and I did see a roving security guard at night. The breakfast provided was your typical continental affair – a lot of carbs: bread, bagels, waffles, cereal, oatmeal, some hard boiled eggs, juice, milk, apples, oranges, etc. No complaint about it other than there tends to be a constant line for people attempting to toast something. There was a pool that looked clean and appealing and I did see some people use it – though I never got around to it. The restaurant Ricky’s was next door, and found it to be a good place for half of the meals consumed while in S.D. I had read before that there was a Target somewhere close by but I never saw it. There was a mini mart/liquor store ~ 1/2 mile down the road and that fit the bill for quick convenience. My t.v. did act up while there, but I never said anything about cause I could make it work “good enough” and I was pretty spent from the day’s exploration and tended to fall asleep – which was the main purpose of the room. Overall I’d use this hotel again if in San Diego. There was 5.00 fee to park per day...

Reviews.Title: “Please stay avoid this hotel and its staff.”
Reviews.Author: asolo55
Reviews.Content: Very upset at the way i was treated by GM and Manager, it seems like a family run unit. Rooms were bad, they were also misleading. The staff needs to learn how to talk to a loyal customer they have no clue. The agent and the manager are laughing in the back while me and my wife were asking simple questions. I have already called Choice to take their sign away. GM thinks he is an expert in everything thing but can't keep his hotel room clean and staff to do their duty. The housekeeping ladies are nice but over worked. Some state agency should look into possible breaking of law in to this operations. Over all a family run unit with bad service.

Reviews.Title: “It was a good deal for us”
Reviews.Author: Humphryg
Reviews.Content: Since we were 5 people, we were forced to get a "suite" - basically 2 rooms with 2 queens each with a connecting door. Price was reasonable for 2 rooms. The beds were comfortable, the place was clean, and breakfast was better then most of the same priced hotels. The only thing I hated was the $5 per night parking fee - why?

Reviews.Title: “average at best”
Reviews.Author: dlnappy
Reviews.Content: I booked a room that included a queen bed and bunk beds. This room was very small compared to a room that would have 2 doubles or 2 queens. The mattresses were older and were somewhat "saggy". The breakfast was very good and a pleasant surprise. Overall, the room was quiet, clean, but needed a little updating. The location was very close to the zoo and to a mall that had a variety of restaurants. Hotel staff was very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it!”
Reviews.Author: Frangoes
Reviews.Content: I came to check the local attractions while heading to L.A. I thought San Diego was very nice and thought the hotel was very well situated. The mall is close - fahsion valley. No sports games in town, but would be a good location to see a sports game when they are. enjoyed visiting the beach and the spanish looking building ont he hill. I thought the staff was nice for a hotel. The room was a little old, but cozy. Got a cheap rate and that's fine with me when the mattress is good and free breakfast! If your in SD to see attractions, this hotel is great and easy to work with.

Reviews.Title: “Smelly Noisy”
Reviews.Author: FamilyGuy505
Reviews.Content: This hotel the worst I have ever been at in San Diego,The room was very smelly like urine,the toilet in our room was clogged when we checked in.The ceiling above us was constantly creaking and we could hear running all hours of the day/night...Their pool closes way too early.The breakfast is average.They charge for parking yet I never once seen a security guard there.If your expecting a good relaxing hotel dont stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Stay at Comfort Inn”
Reviews.Author: rebel-14
Reviews.Content: Good Location and easy to find. There are a few restaurants within walking distance. One thing I can't figure out is why hotels in this area make guests pay for a parking pass- when I stayed (in the off-season) parking pass was $5, but I noticed another review mentioned a $7 parking pass. The hotel next door does not charge for parking, so its hit and miss for that. The breakfast is basically bread, there was not a waffle iron when we stayed here, just juice, bagel, toast, and oatmeal packets with hot water, muffins and a type of danish, but really nothing hot. The bathrooms are very small, and the rooms aren't that big either, but they are clean. Hotel front desk has been helpful-both during check in, and when we needed extra towels. We got this hotel through a bundle package through expedia and got it for $50, but we then paid for a second night and got a rate closer to $70. I wouldnt pay more than $90 for this hotel when I see prices comparing it with other hotels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Thought I booked a deal! I was wrong”
Reviews.Author: jelinavy
Reviews.Content: I was branching out from my usual marriott hotel stays. I wish I didnt. Really regret doing so. I was looking for a weekend getaway to spend with my boyfriend who was in the Navy and was trying to save a few hundred. So instead of flying I took the greyhound (regret as well) and booked this hotel for 3 nights. Which came out to about 250-270. Location is poor. There is no eateries within walking distance except for a Ricky's Resturaunt which was right next door. Decent food, great hash browns. That was probably the only highlight of this whole trip. Closest Liquor store was a 15 minute walk down the street. Hotel does not sell any juice, snacks etc. Except for their vending machines Eh no thanks. When i first arrived at the hotel I asked to check in early. I was about 3hrs early before check in. Mind me I am used to being able to check in early at marriotts. Never have I stayed at another chain before. Desk Clerk was kind of rude. I waited in their tiny lobby for about an hour. First off the only "Nice" looking part of this hotel was the hobby and the outside of the lobby. The rooms are actually located in the back and look very janky and gross. Walking up the stairs (no elevators) I got into my room. First thing I noticed was the smell. It smelled like mold literally. I went back down and asked for an air freshener. They gave me a bottle of fabreeze that was used and and all that was left was really water. The floor felt gross on my skin. My feet were dirty after just unpacking my belongings. I layed towels around the floor. (That desperate) I bared with this ho(MO)-tel for 3 nights and couldnt wait to get out. I feel like the pictures were really misleading. My review is pretty naggy but I am sorry I was so unsatisfied with my stay. I will never be going back to this hotel unless I was desperate and every single hotel in san diego was book. Anyways that was my experience cheers to you if you enjoyed your stay just trying to be honest oh and they offer free breakfast. gets pretty crowded but i managed to grab some toast and juice

Reviews.Title: “A Place to Lay Your Head”
Reviews.Author: dano9258
Reviews.Content: Don't get this hotel confused with the Comfort Inn and Suites just two blocks west of it. We thought when we booked it, that we were getting the other hotel, and as it turns out, we found out why our price was so low. This is a basic motel with nothing real great. Our entire trip was 3 days, and we didn't have any major issues, but we didn't feel real safe at night. It was close to the train station to get to the Chargers game, but other than that, nothing great to say about the location. Overall, just a place to lay your head....nothing more.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Location”
Reviews.Author: LA066
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights, mainly with the aim of taking a quick look at San Diego and then going to Tijuana for a day trip. The hotel is very clean and functional and is reasonable value. The breakfast is included and is acceptable. The staff are efficient. It's really only a place to put your head down for the night. It's not a luxury place for relaxation. It is located quite some distance away from downtown and the harbour. If you are staying here, you will definitely need a car as it is a 15 minute drive to downtown on the freeway. The surrounding area is "hotel city" with both sides of the busy freeway dominated by hotels. It's a busy, noisy area with lots of traffic. There are absolutley no eating options nearby other than one steak restaurant located on the hotel's parking lot. The food there was terrible. Every time you need anything - food, drink, shops etc, you will need to jump in your car and head downtown. This becomes tedious after a while. I will recommend staying downtown for not much more money.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Experience for Budget Minded Travellers”
Reviews.Author: 24traveler24
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this Comfort Inn for 3 nights while touring San Diego. The location was fantastic being in the hotel circle, and whether you stay at this hotel or another in the hotel circle, I recommend staying in the hotel circle overall, as it offers easy and convenient access to everything San Diego offers. The hotel is basic, with nothing to brag about. We chose this hotel as the Ramada next door which seemed to get much better reviews was fully booked, plus we got a great deal on this one with a Room Saver coupon for $59/night. They were heavily booked at the time of our stay, but we managed to get a room with 2 queen beds. The hotel is 2 floors and we were on the 2nd floor. The rooms are accessed from the outdoors, with parking spots in front of the rooms (for an additional $5 fee). The room smelled fine, with no bad noticeable smells. It was dated and definitely could use new bed spread covers, drapes and carpet, but the sheets were clean and the bed was comfortable. The separate bathroom includes a toilet and tub/shower combo and it was very small, but manageable and clean. The sink is on the outside in the main sleeping/sitting area. This was fine with us, as it can prove to be convenient to use while someone is using the toilet or shower. The TV was useless as most channels were grainy with very poor reception. We didn't complain about this as we opted instead for Internet use, which includes free wi-fi in the room, which was reliable enough. The breakfast room was quite large which was a plus, compared to other hotels similar to this, offering free breakfast, but the set up created inconvenient back logs, especially while waiting for the waffles. The breakfast choices were typical of a continental breakfast, however offered nothing of value for a health conscious individual, aside from apples and oranges. We mainly used this hotel for a good night's sleep while touring San Diego, and generally recommend it if you are on a budget and not expecting anything too spectacular of a hotel experience but want a convenient good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Value”
Reviews.Author: TXlady11
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be a very good value and is in a great location. The staff was very nice in both the lobby and the breakfast area. The room was clean and everything was in working order. The bed was also very comfortable. I went to the breakfast each morning and it was great- I loved the waffles. Unfortunately it rained the whole time I was there, so I never got to use the pool. Since I was in town for work, the free internet came in handy to finish up some work each night. If you are looking for an affordable, clean hotel in a great location, I recommend this Comfort Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Well located place, slightly expensive, smelly rooms but good overall”
Reviews.Author: ClintSantiago
Reviews.Content: Not to be confused with the bigger Comfort Inn on Hotel Circle North, there’s only one thing stopping me from staying here again: the unbearable smell of the rooms: moldy and humid. I checked two different rooms, in both floors: same smell. I can’t imagine how it could be in summer, but in mid-October it was strong enough to make me think about moving elsewhere after the first night. We ended up staying three nights, because travelling with a baby means powerful an demanding logistics. Turning the AC on helped with the smell during the day while we were not in the room. These rooms are simply not ventilated! Besides that and the 5 dollar parking charge, an acceptable place overall, slightly expensive for what it is. THE GOOD: - Correctly sized room with a big standard TV (not many channels, and just one for kids) and two queen beds, no refrigerator no microwave oven, coffee machine. Shower head, bathtub and water temperature OK. - Two ice machines, both on the first floor. - WiFi Internet connection worked well inside the room - Room was overall clean (but I’m not the guy looking for bed bugs in every hotel room anyway) - Average American continental breakfast buffet (toasts, bagels, waffles to be made by guest, cereals, cupcakes, pastries, cream cheese, ham, boiled eggs (very cold, direct from the fridge, probably made the day before). Coffee, milk, good orange and apple juice. No cheese, ham, bacon, or scrambled eggs. Machine made hot chocolate (too sweet to ne drinked) - House keeping was OK (last day they forgot to leave towels in the room) - Friendly front desk staff - Italian restaurant next door (was closed at 8 PM on Thursday), and some other places to eat down the street (5-10 minute walk) - Good location, close to Sea World, Balboa Park, Old Town, Airport (of course you need a car, unlike the Days Inn Motel on the same street, there’s no complimentary shuttle). Only hotels in the neighbourhood, if you need groceries there’s a small store down the street. - Did not use the pool, but it’s heated THE BAD - Sink outside the bathroom (Why do they do that?) - Annoying 5 dollar parking charge (first time in my life and I’m well travelled) - Checked in on Thursday for a three night and was told the price was 69, but on the bill the charges for Friday and Saturday were 89. I know this is normal, but they should have told me before they swiped my credit card. Would not have paid 89 if I had more time to look for a place to stay and certainly not if I has checked the room before. - Breakfast fruit (apples and oranges) as seen on the big LED screen on the street, showed up only for the weekend - A/C too loud, impossible to sleep while it’s on, fortunately weather was kind of cold and we did not need it. We heard the appliance from next room. Would try the Ramada next door or maybe the Days Inn next time.

Reviews.Title: “average at best”
Reviews.Author: NLMorris
Reviews.Content: They had to move us 3X because the rooms they checked us into smelled moldy. The first room we had to stay in because it was late and they were overbooked. That AM we went to the FD to change rooms and they wouldn't let us changed rooms until 4ish! We kept calling too. We sat at the pool the entire time. Then, that room was about as bad as the first and we switched again this time to an upper level. Otherwise the staff is nice.

Reviews.Title: “What a Dump”
Reviews.Author: Jeninden
Reviews.Content: This motel was by far the worst place I've ever stayed. The rooms smelled like urine and the upholstery on the chairs had water stains all over - which I'm inclined to think is actually urine. The hot breakfast is a diabetics nightmare and rather deceiving. The only hot items they carry are a make your own waffle station and microwave oatmeal. Virtually no protein to be found. The pool had dead bugs and grass - didn't look like it was cleaned on a regular basis. Maid service was mediocre. No business office - the manager told us to go to the Ramada next door to print our boarding passes - very tacky. We (and there were 10 of us) were very sorry to have chosen this dump for our family get together.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: MrsPicky40
Reviews.Content: This Comfort Inn is a rip off. Advertised in the Room Saver booklet to provide Deluxe Rooms with breakfast, it caught my eye. For 79 $ not really a bargain. A motel, which charges by the way 5 $ extra for parking. The carpet was dirty and the vanity was not the cleanest either. The sheet set had a see through hole. One of the wall lights in the bedroom didn't work at all and the ceiling light in the bathroom was flickering only. The Deluxe breakfast consisted of a variety of pastries and bagels, as well as waffles - big deal. Unfortunately, the coffee was cold. Far away from claiming to be Deluxe.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Decent!!!”
Reviews.Author: June6186
Reviews.Content: Ok, this hotel was decent. Our trip was based on Sea World. We got a room with 2 queen beds. We got our room for $85/night with AAA. Our travel group included my dad and my brother and sister (both 17). We thought that the hotel was great. The room, shower, and beds were clean. I recommend to definitely try to get a room on the second floor, because at night the car's headlights go through the 1st floor room windows. Also, you want to get a room towards the back. The hotel was only three miles (5 minutes via freeway) away from SeaWorld and only 5-10 minutes away from Old Town. After reading the previous reviews and about the breakfast and actually attending it, I have this to say: If you get there between 6:30am and 7:15am then there will not be a crowd and you can easily make your waffle and toast your bagel/bread. If you get there any later, expect to wait because it gets crowded and especially when the hotel is completely booked. The waffle maker becomes a disaster when people make more than one waffle and a line begins to form. The trick for the bagel toasting, is to put it in the toaster and then put in in the movable toaster rack. We did not eat dinner at Ricky's Diner, because it was closed due to the massive egg recall. However, I do recommend going to Old Town and eat in the area where it is closed off to cars. There are a lot of neat little shops. The pool was OK. If you have kids then it is great because it is very family friendly. It is packed at night because everyone leaves their rooms by day and comes back at night. The only problems that I had with the hotel was that there were no recycling bins. Also, the pillows were about half the size of a normal standard pillow. The $5 parking charge was not great but at a budget hotel then it is fine. The parking lot was a little crowed, but you just have to deal with it and carefully park your car. The hotel is across the street from the freeway but it is not directly next to it like the other Comfort Inn in the same general area. Don't expect a Ritz Carlton/ Hilton/ Shearton when you book this hotel. If you just need a place to sleep after a long/exciting day at SeaWorld, or exploring San Diego then this is a fabulous hotel.

Reviews.Title: “VERY AVERAGE HOTEL but good location”
Reviews.Author: KSScubaDiver
Reviews.Content: In the San Diego area it is difficult to get a good hotel at a reasonable price. We are from the midwest and have always had very good experiences with Comfort Inn hotels. However, I would rate this Comfort Inn more comparable to a lower scale Motel 6. It was ok, but not great. The breakfast area in the morning is a complete DISASTER and the gals working the breakfast area are not friendly or helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingBambi
Reviews.Content: I booked this motel through Priceline. Since I know PL only guarantees double occupancy, I called well in advance to request two beds. This is almost always granted by other hotels. When I arrived, I again asked the front desk person if it was possible to get two beds. He said NOTHING to me, just kept clicking away on his keyboard. He handed me the keys and pointed the way to the room. He gave me a king room. The AC was awful, you'd freeze with the AC or die with just the fan. No happy medium could be found. The breakfast was a joke. The hotel was sold out, so the breakfast room was packed, with only two waffle makers. There weren't any indications of how people should line up for the various foods. The workers would instruct people in Spanish where to line up, but if you weren't bilingual, you could be waiting in the wrong line for 10-20 minutes. Cappucino/ hot chocolate machine was down the whole 4 days we stayed there. Since they had hot water, you'd think they'd supply hot chocolate packets, right. Nope. Housekeeping came at 4:30 pm every day. After a full day of sightseeing with small kids, we expected to come back to a clean room. Alas, no. We had to leave right as the kids started to rest, so the room could be made up. Very often as we were driving through the parking lot, some housekeepers would be strolling down the middle of the road, not moving over to the side for the guests to pass by. One morning we got a call at 7:30am from the "front desk" saying there was a computer glich and I needed to give them my credit card info again. I told them I'd be down in a little while, but then they said it must be done immediately and I could give them the info over the phone. I knew it was fishy, and when I went to the front desk, there were a bunch of other people saying they received similar calls. Obviously, the hotel can't stop crank callers, but they didn't offer an apology either. The $5 a night for parking is another pain, especially when a letter at the front desk says it's the cheapest parking in the area. Many of the hotels in Hotel Circle DO NOT CHARGE for parking, so I think FREE is cheaper than $ 5. The TV volume on the regular channels was way lower than the Hotel channel, so you'd have to crank the volume when watching TV, then when you turned it on again, it defaulted to the Hotel channel and it would be blaring! Our last night, a cricket got into the room (it sounded like it was in the AC unit.) Talk about a bad night's sleep. Overall, very disappointed. At least I didn't pay full price.

Reviews.Title: “Sticky carpeting and moldy smell!”
Reviews.Author: travelfoolLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: If you like carpeting that is sticky and a general smell of mold, this is the place for you! Also, if you don't mind teenagers hanging over the 2nd floor railing, yelling at their friends in the parking lot, this is the place for you. The only good thing I have to say is the linens and bathroom were clean. There were too many people, the parking lot was very crowded and they charged you $5 per night to park there. Go somewhere else, there are much better places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst place to live”
Reviews.Author: epo2l
Reviews.Content: Please Don't waste your money. I went there with my small kids that place really stinks and bunk bed is too small.Bedding looks like years old . Evenn price was not so cheap for that week i got it around $104 per night so not so cheap .Quality is too bed .don't even think about it. Wi fi does'nt even work . I ended up staying another comfort Inn which is near by and far far better then this.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: K-Corona
Reviews.Content: The service was awful, the rooms were NOT remodeled as they had previously advertised and everything we touched seemed to be crawling with germs. The bathroom was tiny and it took 10 minutes for the bathroom light to click on. Bring your own towels because the ones they had were flimsy and sad. We were originally told that the parking was free but when we checked in it was listed as $5. Not a bad price but I felt they mislead us with the promise of free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone has their own opinion”
Reviews.Author: momof2nwifey
Reviews.Content: I was kind of worried about staying here just because of some of the reviews I have read. I have 2 children under the age of 5 so safety and being comfortable are a big concern. I couldn't pass up the deal I got booking through AAA. Our stay was nice and relaxing and from a mother on a budget it was good enough Pros: The pool was perfect temp. the little tiny pool was perfect size for my 1 year old. and the big pool was great for my oldest. The spa was perfect for me The breafast was free so you really can't complain it was basically danishes, toast, boiled eggs and cereal oh and a waffle iron that had a really long line because you make yoour own. but like i said it was free it was a nice start to the day. cons: The room was fine a little small the only bad thing was the room smelled like cigarettes once we actually figured out the A/C (the knob pointed to high heat but it was on the A/C) it didnt smell anymore. Parking $5 per day didn't really expect that from this hotel but oh well they are tiny spots too. All in all it was a nice hotel I would stay here again with the deal I recieved I think if we didnt recieve this AAA discount then this hotel is overpriced especially when you add on the parking

Reviews.Title: “Nice room and location for all the attractions”
Reviews.Author: Mommy2Tris
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Comfort Inn for one night while in California. We were planning a day trip to the San Diego Zoo and this hotel is about a 10 minute drive from there. The rooms was a fair price and we were pleasantly surprised by the size of it. It had 2 tv's and a sitting area with a pull-out couch that was separated by french doors. The beds were comfortable and the room was very clean. There is a restaurant in walking distance that we heard was very good. We took a ride into the downtown area which was very busy & not for children. The hotel is centrally located and has an outdoor pool. The only negative thing I can think of is the advertised breakfast buffet, which is closer to a continental breakfast. It is a breakfast room on the 4th floor of the hotel & it was very busy. You can make your own waffles but the rest of the food is cold - pastries, cereal, etc. It did the trick though! We just brought the food back to our room to eat since there was no room in the breakfast room. Just mentioning it so you don't expect to find a traditional buffet where they make waffles or omelettes for you.

Reviews.Title: “Do yourself a favor and skip this dump”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyDingo
Reviews.Content: The rooms are much smaller than they appear on the internet (the staff tried to put us in an even smaller room than we reserved in a classic bait and switch scam). Even though we got a so called 2 room suite it was cramped and uncomfortable with a bad couch bed and 2 very uncomfortable double beds. Although It wasn't hot outside the room was stuffy and the air conditioning didn't work at all. After 2 attempts to fix this pile of junk the maintenance man said he couldn't fix it at all. The weekend management offered to put us in yet another room but since we'd already moved once we opted to remain in the same room. Then the toilet clogged up and after they snaked the line it didn't begin functioning until about 12 hours later. As for the free breakfast it was sparse and over represented in the advertisement. The breakfast room was over crowded with a bunch of rude, psychotic deadbeats who wanted their monies worth so we ate someplace else for breakfast every single day which was not part of the original plan. The front desk staff pretended to be nice but it was all an act, there was a certain level of condescension there which I did not appreciate at all. On our last day they turned off our room key's and the maid staff let us in without a questioning who we were (Thats a big red flag). When I inquired with the front desk they gave me some lame excuse about the card being magnetized. I felt they turned off our keys in retaliation for our numerous complaints regarding the air conditioning and their attempt to swindle us with a smaller cheaper room than what we paid for. This place should be part of a corporate case study on bad management because it's a nice facility that's being run into the ground by poorly trained people who could care less about paying customers. I would not recommend this motel to my worst enemy or his dog. There are so many choices in San Diego do yourself a favor and find another place to stay. Sleep tight and don't let the bed bugs bite...

Reviews.Title: “do not believe everything you read”
Reviews.Author: blsultan
Reviews.Content: I was not sure I wanted to stay here after reading the reviews. My daughter and I found a clean hotel, a good selection of breakfast foods, and a very helpful hotel staff. We found pizza flyers in our door on two days. There is no way for the hotel to stop the delivery of flyers since the hotel does not have security at the entrance. We did not rent a car and the hotel staff was very helpful in contacting Colonial Cab. The driver Abe, who we used on a few occasions was very polite, and reliable. We used Grayline to go to Legoland and Wild Animal Park, they picked us up next to the hotel and dropped us off right in front of the hotel for a much cheaper price than taking a taxi. I would recomend this hotel. We had an enjoyable visit to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for the price”
Reviews.Author: ocsheena85
Reviews.Content: Pros:Updated and modern lobby and rooms, Clean, Great Cont. Breakfast (6:30am-9:30am), Key activated elevators (safety), short drive to many tourist locations Cons: No table or desk in King bedroom, VERY noisey room (422) next to breakfast room (the only one in the hotel), right next to busy freeway

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here So much competition on Hotel Circle. Skip this place.”
Reviews.Author: MKUltra3340
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights Dec 8-10. Upon arrival, the check in was fast. The front desk agent, Crystal is genuinely friendly and very knowledgable. To be frank, she is too good for this place. In terms or size, the room was fine, but the nightstand had a large wad of gum stuck on it. I honestly don't know how it could be missed by competent maid doing even the most cursory tidying. We were tired after a long drive in from Yuma, and wanted dinner, so I didn't address it right away. Big mistake. The following morning, I wrote on the notepad (on the night stand) that is needed to be cleaned. When I returned, the notepad and pen were gone, but the wad of gum was still there! We also killed 6 large crickets in our room (only slightly less horrifying than cockroaches). We also found a small bug in the bedding on the 3rd day which may or may not have been a bedbug (no other signs of bedbugs were found) and we changed rooms immediately. Other than the insects, the beds were comfortant, except that the 2 rooms we were in didn't have proper standard size pillows. Instead, the hotel uses small throw cushion size ones, which I did not like. I know this isn't a fancy place, but come on! Even a fleabag motel has proper pillows. The bathroom sink is in the living area, separate from the toilet/tub/shower. All I could think was how often is that door knob cleaned?!? The towels were fine, about what I expected, and the toiletries were replaced when we ran out. As mentioned in previous reviews, the hotel is "flyered" daily. Menus for a pizza and a Mexican restaurant were shoved through the door every evening. This actually gave me a good scare the first night because before the flyer was totally shoved through it sounded like someone was trying to "jimmy" (pick ) the lock with a credit card or something. I don't know if there is any legal recourse to stop this, but I suggest the hotel try to do something to put a stop to this. The photo of the free breakfast on the hotel's site, and on the sign in front of the hotel of the are totally inaccurrate. I would go as far as to say it's false advertising but hey! You can't expect much for a free, right? The was a VERY SMALL selection of fruit (apples and oranges only nothing like the photos), and the usual cheap, high sugar, empty calorie crap- Fruit Loops, donuts, store bought pasteries, etc. I did not use or even look at the pool area, so I cannot comment on it. I am really trying to think of something positive, but all that comes to mind is Crystal, and the famiy owed restaurant (Ricky's) next door. We ate there 4 or 5 times- each time the service and food were great! Oh- and the free wireless was fast and problem free. I encourange you not to book this hotel. There are literally DOZENS of hotels on Hotel Circle Dr and all of them had the same rate or lower than this place.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, small and basic and you even get charged for parking...”
Reviews.Author: Bandit-One
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in summer 2009 on our way crossing the US. It was a thursday and we were looking for something close to a mall and possibly not far away from the Zoo. Most Motels are located around this area, so we checked out almost every single place around this area. Well....many of the were fully booked! So we continued to drive up and down the road. Some Hotels had rooms left...but we didn't feel like spending 150-200$ for a night at the Interstate. So we called some Motel Hotlines and were happy to get a room in a nicer Comfort Inn. But just to find out that the guy at the phone made a mistake and got us a room here (instead of a pretty good Comfort Inn, a little east from this place....but we checked and it was booked out too). So annoyed and tired from around 2 hours driving back and forward we decided to stay here for the night. So if you get to San Diego, make sure you make a reservation, if not, you'll lose lots of time and nerves!! This Motel here is you typical roadside place to crash. Check-in was fine enough and the desk clerk told us we got a really good price. C'mon....100$ on a weekday? For this kind of Motel?? Ok, they had a nice pool...but we didn't care about it. Plus, you get to pay 5$ for parking a day....on a roadside chain motel. I mean, we traveled around the US a lot...and this is the first time a chain motel charges for parking! The rooms were really basic and small, but clean enough. No fridge, no microwave. There were lots of people whole day and whole night....so it wasn't quiet! The location would have been ok, just next to a mall and about 10 minutes away from the Zoo (a great Zoo). If we would have had any other choice, we would have stayed somewhere else...next time I just might spend 200$ and check-in in a better place. I know California isn't cheap, but they charge too much in this place. Wanna know more about my trips? Click on my profile or visit: route66traveler.jimdo.com

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: bobtbentley
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel for our family. We stayed for 4 nights and had the two room suite which was great for our family of 5 children. It included a nice kitchen which was great to prepare our own food and save money. The rooms were clean and the front desk was helpful. We also got a great deal. I would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good, Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: ancientchild
Reviews.Content: Prior to booking, I read reviews about this hotel. Comments about the pool and workout room didn't really pertain to me, but I was concerned about the noise that others had experienced. For my budget range, it seemed to have the most stars. Since I wasn't planning on spending too much time in the hotel and most people said it was clean, I went ahead and booked the room. Negatives: walls were so thin I could hear when our neighbor's door unlocked; musty odor in the room; the lights by the sink were dim; we had to evacuate after a fire alarm went off at about 7pm (false alarm); Ice machine and snacks were not centrally located; run-down hotel next door, but no problems because of it. The positives: staff was very helpful and accommodating; room was clean and decorated nicely; flat screen TV; free internet in room; close to everything; water temperature in shower did not fluctuate. Our stay wasn't so bad that I felt we had to leave, but the odor, being able to hear others talking, and hearing doors open and close, bothered me more than I thought it would. I'll probably try another place next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great little budget hotel and perfectly located for exploring the area”
Reviews.Author: AJ_Canvey
Reviews.Content: This was a brilliant little find. It's a recently done up budget hotel, it's great, great value for money, but clean and fairly modern too. We picked it due to budget and location and couldn't have asked for a better place to stay. Perfectly located for the Gaslamp Quarter, Old Town, Zoo and Qual Comm stadium. The staff were super helpful, esp Wendi on reception who helped us with endless qestions on local public transport when we were planning days out! There's also free wi-fi in your room, and my brother loved the huge HD TV. On the down side, there is only one restaurant (albeit a very nice one) in the immediate area. You would need to drive or get transport into town if you wanted some variety. The pool area is located right next to the car park, so we didn't use that either.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, reasonably quiet and good value with convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Ek_NZ
Reviews.Content: I'd stayed at the LA Comfort Inn at Vermont/Beverly which was a little bit dated & noisy (see review) so I wasn't expecting much from this place - particularly after driving up to it on the busy Hotel Circle road. In fact the location itself was great. Just 5 minutes from the Fashion Valley shopping centre and a few minutes or less from the freeway entry/exits. However, our room was behind the front/roadside reception/room building and set far enough not to hear any roadside noise. The reception staff were efficient and seemed friendly enough. The room itself had a decent little kitchen and dining table (which was the main reason my gf and I chose the Comfort Inn) and the place was actually pleasant to stay in - reasonably modern, not overly cramped, nice bathroom. All the Comfort Inns have free wireless internet which is great when travelling and planning etc. It was pretty hot in San Diego at the time and while the room had a very efficient aircon it unfortunately was too noisy to leave on during the night even at the lowest setting. We instead max. the aircon to chill the room and then turned it off - but still slightly uncomfortable (this was the same as for the LA Comfort Inn). The place was chocka full of guests at the time (a couple of soccer teams) so the breakfast room was a bit like the freeway at 7am (not quite bumper to bumper but busy). I imagine some people would love the breakfast offering - muffins, pastries, waffle maker, cereal, juices, coffees teas, apples and oranges, boiled eggs but I'm a bit more into slightly healthier fare so I would have preferred more fruit and muesli. Still can't complain much as I think its a pretty good selection for most. In terms of value, I got this really cheap from Expedia so overall I am really really satisfied with this place.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, but a lot of kids around”
Reviews.Author: mis1180
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for 3 nights while in san diego for a wedding. it was a decent hotel, good location, room was clean. we ended up in a room right on the highway so it was a little bit noisy, but the white noise from the A/C unit helped to drowned it out enough. we don't have any children, and noticed that there were A LOT of families staying here (makes sense being that its so close to sea world and the zoo). breakfast was absolutely insane in the mornings- chaotic and noisy. we would usually scope out a table by the pool before we got our food, so it was a little bit quieter. they should maybe change the layout somehow so that there is a little bit more organization to the "flow" of people getting their food. i would recommend it to families or people who don't mind seeing children around- its a clean hotel in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel, staff fine but mangagment AWFUL”
Reviews.Author: FireWlff
Reviews.Content: DON'T BUY PACKAGE AS A GIFT! I bought this Comfort Inn Hotel/Sea World tix package as a gift for some in-laws over the internet. While ordering, the site said "prepayment required" which we THOUGHT was done. When our relatives came, they matched the website pictures to the hotel down the STREET because this hotel was a bit old and worn-looking, though at least CLEAN and worn-looking inside. It turns out the tickets are NOT prepaid, so you must purchase them there at the hotel, BUT YOUR FIRST RECIEPT STILL LOOKS LIKE (and says) IT'S PREPAID! Plus your credit-card statement shows at least a hold for that amount, so it's confusing to determine on-the-fly what exactly is going on... ESPECIALLY when the manager wont listen to your concerns over the phone, he just keeps repeating that you have to pay. It's annoying and stands in the way of your gift recipient's enjoyment.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: AliBear19
