Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights on a recent visit to San Diego. The location was wonderful for our trips to the zoo, seaworld and the wild animal park. We had a two bedroom/one kitchenette room, which worked well for us. There was also lots of shopping and restaurants nearby. We spent a few evenings by the pool and in the hot tub. Overall, an excellent location and a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Smallest hotel room on the planet”
Reviews.Author: Ejody
Reviews.Content: First, make sure you know which Comfort Inn this is. There's a much nicer one on Hotel Circle North. The photos on this site do NOT accurately represent the property or its amenities. (Esp. the buffet.) 1. Their sign said "Rooms starting at $99". I had the smallest single room I have ever seen-- and I travel a LOT, including overseas. It was $150. Preposterous. Front desk said the sign was incorrect but the manager hadn't changed it. (This is in violation of the law.) 2. I was lead to believe on the website that these were suites. Nope. TINY, one-bed rooms. (Mine was.) It was the smallest room I have ever been in. Almost comical. If it hadn't cost $150 I'd have been laughing instead of crying... 3. Their "breakfast buffet" was a "carbohydrate buffet", absolutely jam packed with so many people and so loud that we couldn't stand it. Not even oatmeal, just cold cereals, some fruit, some mass-packaged, very average pastries, and hard boiled eggs. No thanks. (Photo on site is inaccurate.) Stayed three nights and never ate there. No way. Fine for families with lots of kids who don't care, but not grown-ups. And it was deafeningly loud, and nearly impossible to move around in because of the massive crowd. Terrible. Took us about 30 seconds to decide to get the heck out of there. 3. Lots of "questionable" types staying there (tattoos, missing teeth, lots of smoking cigarettes early morning-- make your own conclusions. Sorry to sound judgmental, but you should know this, esp, if you have kids.) This place is not for everyone. 4. Parking spaces-- if you can find one (something like $5 extra a night) are VERY close together. Be ready for door dings. And due to the clientele, I was concerned with break-ins. 5. Staff was nice and friendly. That's it. Won't be staying there again, not at half the price. Plenty of MUCH nicer hotels surrounding it.

Reviews.Title: “A comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Aussie61
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately we arrived in San Diego on a Saturday night and for some reason the 27th of June was busier than most Saturdays so we had a difficult time finding accommodation. This meant that we paid more than we wanted to but our room was clean and our beds were comfortable. Breakfast was busy but the room is big so it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “It Is What It Is”
Reviews.Author: Busy-retired
Reviews.Content: We did not have great expectations arriving at the hotel. We were traveling with extended family on a limited budget. None of us planned on using the hotel room for anything other than showers and sleep and we did not want to spend lots of money on a fancy name. In many respects we were pleasantly surprised by what we found. The hotel is older, but the rooms had received some attention in the not distant past. We were there with about forty football teams attending a football tournament. When we saw them at check-in I wanted to run in the opposite direction. We never heard them at all. This old concrete block building absorbed noise, and we never heard a voice or a footstep even though we were on the bottom floor next to the stairs. The staff was also attentive and quick to call supervisors if the kids got rowdy. The swimming pool area was clean, and the grandchildren enjoyed it enormously. This hotel enjoys an excellent location with easy on and off ramps. There is nothing much available in terms of food or entertainment within walking distance, but it is California where no one walks anywhere anyway. The breakfast was a great attempt at providing something nice. They offered waffles which you could make yourself, hard boiled eggs, fruit, cereal, a huge assortment of pastries, bagels and a variety of breads to toast yourself as well as juice, milk, tea and coffee. The hotel also offered wireless internet in the guest rooms, which we really appreciated. Now the negatives: The floor did not appear to be overly dirty, but it was filthy. The soles of our feet were black. We bathed the babies and they ran to their beds, and in that short journey we had to wash their feet again. It was unpleasant walking about on the floor because we knew it was dirty. The breakfast was great in concept, but in practice it was a dismal failure. It was like they planned to provide space for fifty people and 300 actually showed up. The space available was completely inadequate to the demands of the guests. The first morning we were lucky enough to grab a small table so we had a place for plates, and somewhere for the little ones to sit. There were two waffle makers and a line of 40 people. In addition, the little football kids knew nothing about making waffles and they slowed the process down enormously. The following three days we went to the breakfast room and collected a few things to bring back to the room - mainly bagels and fruit. It was, however, such an ordeal that on our final two days we just went out to breakfast negating the financial advantage of having breakfast provided with the price of the room. The guest laundry facilities were also completely inadequate for the number of rooms. We waited hours to use the washer and dryer and other guests were not responsible about watching their own laundry making everything even more difficult in terms of time. I thought that the hotel was fine for what it was - an aging hotel trying to keep pace with the 21st Century. If I had paid $70/night I would have even felt OK about the breakfast situation. At $100/night I felt that the hotel was over-priced. If you stay here my advice is to give up the luxury of sleeping in on vacation and arrive at the breakfast room when it opens, or give up on breakfast completely, and try to bring enough clothing so it is not necessary to visit the laundry, and take socks to wear on your feet which you can just throw away when you leave.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly hotel and good value”
Reviews.Author: imagumby
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here late May 09. Got a good deal on Orbiz. Only negative I can think of was the location and having to negotiate San Diego Freeways to get anywhere. Everything else was really great. Nice breakfast, good WiFi in rooms. Plenty parking but cost $5 per night. Hotel was busy but not a problem as they were friendly and efficient. No hesitation in recommending this hotel. Very clean and a very comfortable bed. Swimming pool very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected, but not great.”
Reviews.Author: David-and-Stephanie
Reviews.Content: Based on some of the reviews, we were hesitant to stay here. However, other than a few minor issues, the stay wasn't that bad. The rooms and the rest of the hotel are a lot nicer than it appears from the street. The rooms were in decent shape, though a bit musty. Location was perfect and within minutes of all attractions. Breakfast was just okay and got pretty crowded even at 7:00 am on a (holiday) weekend. It was mainly breads, bagels, some cereal, a few fruit, etc. and, of course, waffles. Not bad, but no hot eggs or anything special. Our main complaints were that they charged for parking. Normally, that isn't a big deal (it was only $5), but the parking was very tight and I had to park far away from the room. Also, the main page of Comfort Inns website even states that there is free parking. To make matters even worse, there was no easy or direct was to get from the car/lobby area to the room. I had to walk all the way around the building because the pool was closed. On a non-holiday weekend, this place would probably be better and it wasn't too bad overall. It wouldn't be my first choice for another stay, but it would be acceptable if there weren't any other options in the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families!”
Reviews.Author: Mimiii
Reviews.Content: We were trying to find an economical place to stay while in town for a relative's graduation from college. This hotel (Hotel Circle SOUTH - there is a different one on Hotel Circle North), is a multi-building facility with lots of rooms. Ours was clean and very comfortable. The front desk staff was welcoming and very accommodating, as were all the other employees on the grounds. I like the fact that they seem to have round the clock faciliites personnel - they were out in their golf carts all the time, and responded to every request immediately. There were lots of families at the hotel, apparently visiting the local attractions. Nevertheless, we always found a nice table at the breakfast buffet. There was a lot of variety, but I would not consider it special. They have waffles, danish and juices, but the only healthy food were hard boiled eggs, apples, oranges and raisin bran cereal. I wish they included some whole grains, such as bran muffins or oatmeal. Fortunately, we had brought our own cereal and other items. This being said, the employees kept the buffet filled and the tables clean all the time. It was a busy yet very clean and inviting environment. The grounds are kept immaculate, and the pool/jacuzzi area is very nice. They even have two barbecue grills there for guests. At other locations around the premises, you can find vending machines with drinks and snacks, ice machines, and a well-lit guest laundry. There is no fitness center, but guests can use the one at a sister hotel down the street. One of our family members used it twice, and reported it to be very nice. There is also a restaurant on the premises, where we ate breakfast when a local friend told us they were famous for their apple pancake, which is a "dutch baby" smothered in cinnamon apples. All the items we ordered at the restaurant were great! For the price, this hotel is a VERY good value. I have stayed in many hotels in San Diego, and even on Hotel Circle, and although this may not be the most luxurious one, it's definitely one of the best in terms of VALUE. We will stay here again on a future trip.

Reviews.Title: “Feel Mislead”
Reviews.Author: rodbrimhall
Reviews.Content: This was suppose to be a 'two room suite'. It is obviously a common motel room that has been divided by a thin sliding door. The convertible sofa in the extra room is the thinnest and most uncomfortable I have ever tried to sleep on. We had to remove all the furniture from that room before we could open the sofa into a bed. The bathroom was never cleaned, although new towels were left. Parking was ridiculous If you arrive after about 8 PM, expect to park elsewhere. . The breakfast is very disappointing. Nothing but pastries, cold cereal and coffee. I think that the hotels web site is very misleading. We wrote a complaint to the hotel and received the typical "we are very sorry, hope you come again... blah, blah" response.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: OntarioCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay here a lot. Breakfast was sensational and good value for monies spent.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, comfortable, good value”
Reviews.Author: BestDealMom
Reviews.Content: For an adult couple and three older teens, the two room suite which is really two rooms, each with a bath was a comfortable accomodation. When traveling with teens it is great to have a separate spot with two queen beds and its own bath for them. We traveled to a debate tournament at the University of San Diego, so this motel was close by and provided good value with enough room for everyone to spread out. It is an older property on Hotel Circle, so considering the location, it was quiet, well appointed with comfortable beds, and fully adequate for a group mainly using for sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: Mamacitadedos
Reviews.Content: Don't expect top quality here. This is a very old motel!!! We stayed in a two room suite, which was nothing more then two adjoining rooms. Kitchen area was not what I expected and it certainly wasn't stocked well. I was shocked they only had two small pans which were only good to cook soup in. The rooms had a terrible smell, I can't even begin to guess what that was. The walls are paper thin! You can hear everything around you and above you! Including the TV's, running kids, etc. The pictures on the website are very misleading. Just remember this is an old motel, nothing special at all!!! There are better places to stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: jamesoz1
Reviews.Content: as expected from Comfort. Clean,good pool,usual breakfast with continental fare + waffles,hard boiled eggs. Couple small tlc issues but overall well kept. Easy access to interstate,old town.Got a good rate

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Staff, but have a car!”
Reviews.Author: traveleer999
Reviews.Content: This hotel had the friendliest staff I have ever encountered! Every visit to the desk was met with a smile, and all requests filled within minutes of asking. The room was really nice (one kitchenette with a connecting room). The only drawback was, you do have to drive everywhere, nothing within walking distance but the decent Ricky's restaurant. Great value for money though, and I would stay here again on a driving trip.

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: ksujeo
Reviews.Content: Very, very small room. Bed was comfortable, but that was the only + to this place. With many other motels in the area, would definitely recommend picking a different one. Breakfast area was so busy and messy, we choose to go to a nearby restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: CraigAWashDC
Reviews.Content: My room was comfortable and clean. It smelled a bit funny - I could not figure out why. The internet worked fine - I was able to do a lot of work between meetings. It is located just down the hill from a great taco restaurant near UCSD Hospital. It was good value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Ugh...”
Reviews.Author: mathrocckrules
Reviews.Content: There isn't anything great about this place. The best thing I can say is that the staff was friendly. There were teenagers knocking on room doors, asking for money, even though our do not disturb sign was on the door. We spoke to family members also staying in this motel and they were also asked for money. We had 10-12 menus pushed through our door at all hours of the night and morning. Very thin walls, could even hear cell phones ringing at 5:00am in the room next to us. Very hard to rest here. My boyfriend took a bite of his cereal in the breakfast room and then immediately had to spit it out because the milk was sour! And our deadlock bolt was missing 3 out of 4 screws.. Very strange place, will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to set up camp in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: SandyToes82
Reviews.Content: A friend of mine and I went to California for a week this past Spring and were planning to stay in San Diego for 3 nights then head up to Anaheim for 2 nights. We booked the Comfort Inn because a friend of ours had recommended it; saying that it was in a good location in relation to the rest of the city. We were a bit skeptical staying in an area called 'Hotel Circle', but we decided to give it a go. Our room was on the second floor of one of the farthest back buildings. The hallways are on the outside of the building and you have to climb a set of stairs to reach the top. The rooms were clean and manageable. No complaints. We took a walk to the pool and found it to look nice; however we didn't use it because it was still too cool in April for the pool. We used the hot tub and it was clean. What we enjoyed the most about it was its proximity to the highway and the different locations we visited. It only took about 15 minutes to get downtown, 15 minutes to Sea World, and about an hour to La Jolla (definitely worth the trip!). People were a bit noisy early in the evenings, but it would quiet down in plenty of time for sleep.

Reviews.Title: “It was great”
Reviews.Author: artandkelly
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here. We had a kids suite that had a separate room w/bunk beds, tv and ac for the kids. It was big enough and so close to Seaworld. The personel were great. It's in a great area of San Diego. We felt safe and very comfortable. The fridge could have been bigger but we had one. If you would like alone time w/your spouse while on a family vacation, this is the room for you. I can't recommend it enough. We will definitely be staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTE, GREAT ROOM, GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: janaeprice
Reviews.Content: We loved it, we walked in because we canceled our other hotel at the last min. and they got us in within 5 mins. And it was wonderful. Nice pool great breakfast great customer service,. We stayed here for 3 nights and the bed was wonderful. We are staying here again in a couple of months. Loved it

Reviews.Title: “30 Usd Incidentals Mistake”
Reviews.Author: miniLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just a motor Inn, close to San Diego. It's not worthy the 150 USD we paid. Sleep and go. That was yesterday. Today, by mere chance, we happened to check the American Express charges and we discovered a 30 USD charge. Through calling hotels.com we know that the charge is for "incidentals" and that it has been a "mistake". We were not notified of the charge at the check-out and we actually requested the "approval for incidentals paper" to be given back to us or destroyed in front of us. Now they say it has been a mistake and that they are going to credit the money back, but one has the bad feeling... If the "mistake" goes unnoticed, it is easy money.

Reviews.Title: “Decent motel - just come expecting nothing more”
Reviews.Author: GarPro
Reviews.Content: San Diego is a relatively 'pricey' place. Trying to find decent accomodations on a budget was difficult. Trying to find a decent place on a budget on short notice is even harder. This place fit the bill. Stayed 5 nights (average of $107 per night pre-tax). This property had a number of positives for us, in addition to the price. 1. Location: From the is property, one can easily access I-8 , I-5 and I-15. Seaworld, San Diego Zoo, and the Airport are all quick drives. The property is backed by a steep hill/cliff and is somewhat separated from the freeway, so road noise is minimal, especially at the back of the property. 2. Breakfast: With 3 hungry boys, the breakfast was a real cost savings for us. Yes, it is crowded. Yes, there isn't any bacon and eggs. Oh well. There were 2 waffle stations, the pastries varied daily, fresh fruit was available, hot and cold cereal choices, coffee, juices, boiled eggs, etc. 3. The room was clean and comfortable - nothing fancy. There was no sign of bugs, or mold, or mold odor (could be the time of year, it wasn't too hot yet). Our room was on the top floor, back end of the building, so it was very quiet. 4. Staff: Pleasant and helpful. We have 2 children who have dairy intolerances and normally use soy milk for cereal/drinking - since the room did not have a refridgerator, we asked to have our carton stored in the breakfast prep room - no problem. The desk staff also helped with airline ticket printing and answering tourist info questions. So what were the cons? Not many. Parking spots are tight - especially if you have a larger vehicle (thank goodness for sliding doors on the van!) Pool was decidely chilly - then again we are from Canada where hotel pools are generally indoors and heated... New mattresses arrived on site the day before we left - just our luck! We ate at the Tickled Trout restaurant (twice) at the Ramada next door. The boys (11,8 and 5) loved it. Great service.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some serious work.”
Reviews.Author: tconk40554Vegas
Reviews.Content: Room smelled of mold. Wireless internet didn't work. Ran out of hot water and had to take a cold shower. The staff was friendly enough but they have an old wreck of a hotel to manage and I will not stay there again unless they do some serious renovations. I can accept that a budget hotel is not the Ritz but it can surely be clean and functional.

Reviews.Title: “Bad in every sense.”
Reviews.Author: travelhelperus
Reviews.Content: Our bathroom was NEVER clean, it usually smelled of urine. The filth, hairs and dirt behind the bathroom door were there when we arrived and stayed there when we left, a week later. Breakfast had nothing to do with the colorful picture they have at the entrance. Our TV didn't work properly and we had to watch pay movies with continuos interruptions of other channels (after alot of arguing, we managed not to get charged for them). Internet never seemed to work correctly, we had to keep logging in or restarting our computer. As soon as our week was through we moved to another hotel in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “There have to be better places!”
Reviews.Author: MarianReader
Reviews.Content: We chose this Comfort Inn because of a recommendation on the CA forum, but we were disappointed. We are Comfort Inn loyalty program members, but unlike HIEX or Fairfield Inn, etc, that doesn't mean anything when you check in or out - you still have to wait in line, and wait for your bill at check out. I did not realize the motel had exterior doors (seem less safe). Maid service was okay but little things were ignored - no fresh bag for ice bucket, no new coffee for coffeemaker, etc. Breakfast was okay. Biggest plus was Ricky's, the very nice, friendly, affordable restaurant on the property.

Reviews.Title: “Crowded Place”
Reviews.Author: Austate
Reviews.Content: The deluxe room was comfortable and clean. Breakfast was aweful. The place attracts family type clients. The breakfast room was packed with hungry people.

Reviews.Title: “Not the worst, but not the best either”
Reviews.Author: heretodaygonetomorrow
Reviews.Content: If you've stayed at a Comfort Inn before you will get pretty much what you expect. We booked a room with bunk beds for the kids -a little cramped, but you're only there to sleep. Having the kitchenette was nice but we had to use the bathroom towels to dry the dishes - no dishtowels. Laundry facilities were excellent and the breakfast, while busy, was good enough. Ricky's Restaurant next door offered good food at reasonable prices. On the downside, the pool area needed to be better lit than it was and if you are on the ground floor, be prepared for noise from the room above you. Overall, a good deal for those travelling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “TV broken.”
Reviews.Author: Donricodelavega
Reviews.Content: There was nothing wrong with the room. It was basic but comfortable. The biggest problem was the TV. It had an issue where it would not switch to regular channels and instead just kept playing the "pay per view" options over and over. And the kicker, is the damn TV wouldn't turn off. Neither the remote or the button on the TV itself wouldn't turn the TV off. So we were stuck listening to commercials for sometimes up to 20 minutes before one of the buttons would finally work to turn it off. I called the front desk to ask for assistance. They said they would send someone but 20 minutes later no one had shown up. By then the TV started acting properly again. The breakfast was o.k. Lots of muffins, danishes and cereals. There was a big line up for the waffle maker. Lots of kids everywhere too. The had warnings in the room about not leaving things open because of possible break ins. They also warned about people putting pizza flyer's under the door and to stay away from them because its people making pizza in their garage without regulations. All these warnings aside it was a decent enough place. We stayed just one night (a Saturday). I've been in much worse.

Reviews.Title: “A little unsafe, but on the thrifty travelor budget”
Reviews.Author: Snappy_Travelor
Reviews.Content: Thifty - that's it - I stayed here for three days. The US Navy and Military does as well. Contential Breakfast is okay. Safety was a concern, someone reported a camera missing in the room. Outside Vendors were seen not only placing flyers under doors but I saw them try opening each door to see if the travelor had left theirs unlocked (this was reported to the office mgr.) If you stay there - if you go sightseeing - take everything with you so you are not unhappy when you return. Rooms are very basic, okay clean, I've been in better "thrifty" locations. Is close by to the Hotel Circle if you have business there, and a pool and jacuzzi - which the military crowd kept full.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price, great service, Very happy costumer”
Reviews.Author: jujubeansmom
Reviews.Content: I was worried on the way because we did not have alot of money to spend on a resort this time and hoped it would be decent. I was pleasently suprised We got an upgrade in the roon, Breakfast was great, room was clean, pool was clean. Staff friendly. close to all attractions

Reviews.Title: “Icky and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: slr_7
Reviews.Content: This is an old hotel. We stayed here 25+ years ago when it was called "7-11". It is a bit run down and needs renovation. The rooms while clean and decently furnished but were very small. Bathroom was the smallest one I have ever stayed in. The breakfast area was very crowded, lacked adequate tables and poorly laid out. In general this is not a bad place if you were paying $60-$80 per night but we paid twice that amount and expected a lot more luxury. There are so many better properties for the same price or substantially less money. Motel Circle sits right on the I-8 freeway. It is very noisy. This is at best a two star hotel and definitely not a three star.

Reviews.Title: “Very small room”
Reviews.Author: crwinter1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night. I booked through an ad in the San Diego visitors guide. The clerk booked us here instead of the one on Del Rio. Customer service got us into one of their other properties for the next 3 nights that had a kids suite (two rooms with a french door in between). We were supposed to have a kids suite and this property only has kids rooms which is a queen bed right next to bunkbeds. The room was way too small to have both a queen and a bunkbed. We were very cramped. I would not recommend this for a family to stay in. Breakfast was fine. Self serve waffles, breads, cereals, fruit and drinks. We arrived just before it closed and did not have to wait at all. We moved the next night over to their other property at 2401 Hotel Circle. Not sure if I would stay there again. I wrote a review for that property as well. Go check it out.

HotelInfo.Name: Comfort Inn & Suites Hotel Circle / SeaWorld
HotelInfo.Address: 2201 Hotel Circle South, San Diego, CA 92108
